title: Social Science Inquiry-Based Academic English Collaborative Project Curriculum for Adult ESL Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English communication skills, general understanding of academic activities, foundational awareness of social phenomena and institutions, and openness to multicultural perspectives
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing collaborative learning in smartphone-based limited-technology environments, aiming to foster civic literacy through social science inquiry and multicultural perspectives. Learners gain experience in evidence-based approaches to solving social issues.

learning_goals: Advanced reading skills and social science inquiry abilities are enhanced through summarizing academic papers and conducting critical analyses of socioscientific variables.

By participating in 8 academic presentations and peer feedback sessions over 6 months, learners can acquire English presentation skills achieving an average of 4.0/5.0 or higher on the presentation rubric (pronunciation, fluency, organization, visual aid utilization), meet or exceed 80% feedback implementation, and strengthen academic communication and civic literacy.

In teams of 4, learners select one socioscientific topic (history, culture, institutions, relationships, etc.) and complete a collaborative research project within 6 months, write a 15+ page APA-formatted paper (draft and final version), and achieve an average of 4.0 or higher on a 5-point scale in peer and instructor evaluation rubrics.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
